subs.text: July 6
@jenrazzle It‚Äôs better in reverse. When I get up in MN, work day in Germany is nearly done and all problems are either already solved or were not that important anyway! üòõ

subs.text: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH I‚Äôve had Global Entry for a couple years and it is 100% worth it. I had to wait a few months to get approved and be told to make an appointment, and that was in good times.
subs.rawText: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH I‚Äôve had Global Entry for a couple years and it is 100% worth it. I had to wait a few months to get approved and be told to make an appointment, and that was in good times.

subs.text: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH Although it didn‚Äôt really pay off until my wife had it too. I‚Äôd get done with the kiosk in 2 minutes and wait for her 45 minutes to get through the line. And it is a bit creepy to not show your passport and enter on facial recognition alone.
subs.rawText: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH Although it didn‚Äôt really pay off until my wife had it too. I‚Äôd get done with the kiosk in 2 minutes and wait for her 45 minutes to get through the line. And it is a bit creepy to not show your passport and enter on facial recognition alone.

subs.text: I flew to MSP early, wife is joining me Friday on our original flight. Her first leg HAM-AMS just canceled, she now flies through CDG. Can‚Äôt pick seats, but at least she has one. #AirTravelMeltdown

subs.text: July 5
My normal travel schedule to the US qualifies for Silver status on Delta, but I‚Äôve gotten so many apology miles the past year I‚Äôll hit Platinum with my next trip. #AirTravelMeltdown

subs.text: July 4
The good news: my brother is out of the hospital and I‚Äôm home with my mother. The bad news: today it will be 95¬∞F (35¬∞C) with humidity to match (95%). [link]

subs.text: July 2
Good news! The procedure went well and my brother could be released tomorrow or Monday. And the car is being brought here today. [link]
subs.rawText: Good news! The procedure went well and my brother could be released tomorrow or Monday. And  the car is being brought here today. https://t.co/zw1lI2Q9dK

subs.text: Also note that I‚Äôve lived in Germany so long I felt a strong urge to air out my room. [link]

subs.text: I was able to open the funny American windows! Maybe I should make a YouTube video. (Inside American-in-Germany joke.) [link]

subs.text: @tehnyit Seeing their faces last night made the travel stress well worth it! As for the car, if the mountain will not come to Muhammad, then Muhammad must go to the mountain.
subs.rawText: @tehnyit Seeing their faces last night made the travel stress well worth it! As for the car, if the mountain will not come to Muhammad, then Muhammad must go to the mountain.

subs.text: Good morning from Gorecki Guest House at St. Cloud Hospital. My brother is next door for a hopefully routine procedure. My mom is with him 120 miles from home, where she left her car because she can‚Äôt drive. I‚Äôm now here, also without a car but I can drive. We‚Äôll work this out. [link]

subs.text: July 1
Taking shuttle from MSP to St. Cloud. From European airport chaos into 4th of July weekend traffic.

subs.text: @tessaapproves @bzbear2 Maybe there are ingredients not available or not legal here. High-fructose corn syrup? Or maybe they have to use real orange flavoring. Similar reasons why McD strawberry shakes taste different in Germany.

subs.text: @NuwOne Because of the current situation at airports. We saw a YouTube video from a woman saying she can travel for a month out of a carry-on and a small backpack. I thought I‚Äôd try it, and my wife will too when she joins me next week.

subs.text: @NuwOne I‚Äôm usually a chicken guy. And I‚Äôve never been a wine for breakfast guy!
subs.rawText: @NuwOne I‚Äôm usually a chicken guy. And I‚Äôve never been a wine for breakfast guy!

subs.text: @NuwOne Ha! Would have loved a French breakfast at CDG, but too crowded so I had to wait for ‚Äúchicken or pasta‚Äù on the plane. Funniest thing was the lady on the first leg complaining that Air France did not offer wine at 6:30am!
subs.rawText: @NuwOne Ha! Would have loved a French breakfast at CDG, but too crowded so I had to wait for ‚Äúchicken or pasta‚Äù on the plane. Funniest thing was the lady on the first leg complaining that Air France did not offer wine at 6:30am!

subs.text: CDG was chaotic (strikes, but only a bit more chaos than usual for CDG). Passport control took 35 minutes), takeoff was an hour late. Woke up from my nap to see we‚Äôre approaching Greenland. [link]

subs.text: Just got a mail from Delta apologizing for not loading all checked luggage onto the plane. Crew hasn‚Äôt announced anything yet. Good thing I didn‚Äôt check anything!

subs.text: @deutschbitte My home LK Harburg offers 4th boosters to all adults 6 months after the 3rd. There are 4 stations in Winsen, Fleestedt, Neu Wulmstorf and Buchholz. We don‚Äôt have 4th boosters yet, this is the info from the LK. [link]
